metadata.title: CVE-2021-32837 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
mechanize, a library for automatically interacting with HTTP web servers,contains a regular expression that is vulnerable to regular expressiondenial of service (ReDoS) prior to version 0.4.6. If a web server respondsin a malicious way, then mechanize could crash. Version 0.4.6 has a patchfor the issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32837` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-mechanize - 1:0.4.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-mechanize package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:0.4.7-1').
